pullRequest.body:
If the build passed, the label will be removed shortly thereafter; for failing builds, the label will stay around (which is a small change in behaviour).

This has the side-effect that completing CI always causes a visible state change to a PR, so e.g. the queueboard can pick up this change reliably.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [03ff30d37f](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21881/commits/03ff30d37ff065a6383e212ae6e09d31103d6325)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

@adomani @bryangingechen I guess this change is straightforward from an implementation perspective. Would you like to weigh in on the "do we want to make this change" side? I'm proposing this to make the metadata updating for the queueboard more reliable: the current mechanism still falls behind (and recovers later, but with a delay) because of this. I'm hoping for this to be the last blocker to switching purely to aggregate metadata, which is both simpler and a pre-requisite for much faster updating of the queueboard webpage in the future. See https://github.com/jcommelin/queueboard/issues/69 for the bigger picture.

In principle I'm not too opposed to this, but I have been putting this off since I haven't had a chance to look at the related "aggregate data" PRs on the queueboard side. Since it seems I probably won't be able to get to that today either, I guess my main question is this: is it really necessary to use a label to track the CI status? I would have thought that it would be possible to query for PRs where the CI status of the build job is still "in progress" vs finished (again, I ask this without having looked at how queueboard works, so I'm probably missing something).

If we merge this PR, there is a most likely negligible cost in terms of additional `GITHUB_TOKEN` usage, which I don't think is a problem. However, I'm more concerned about the added complexity of having business logic in other repos that depends on labeling / unlabeling here.

I do not really know what the intention is with the queueboard side of the story, but, instead of using a label, could you not add a step that directly updates the queueboard with the appropriate information?

Such a step would be a github webhook which downloads updated metadata for this PR.

This would be the ideal solution; I agree. When that lands, I'd remove the change in this PR. However, I don't know how to write one, and would rather land this now, validate that this is the missing piece for reliable metadata updates, and make this more robust later.
(In any case, help with creating one would be welcome. I know which code needs to be called, I just don't know my way around the overall infrastructure, and found github's documentation to be... hard to digest.)

Moving to a webhook-based metadata update will need to happen anyway to make the queueboard update in a more real-time manner: this will remain a temporary step anyway.

OK, let's merge this because I don't want to keep you blocked. If you have a chance to write up more details about what precisely you need on the queueboard side (or even just pointers to certain parts of the current code which I should study) I'll take a look.
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13372854553/job/37345200951)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13372854553/job/37345201366)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CI): add awaiting-CI label when a build finishes

source.title: change(dashboard.py): use aggregate data as single source of truth
